A message from Superintendent Mr. Jamie Hermann,

First, I would like to thank you for the instruction and assistance you have given during this past quarter of school. The COVID event has created situations and put parameters around us that we are unaccustomed to having, so I thank you for your flexibility and understanding.

We made it together. Next week will be the final week for our students and staff, true to form next Sunday, May 17th, we will send another class from Kadoka High from student status to alumni status. I would also like to invite you all to school next Monday and Tuesday to return books and computers, sit down and visit with your child's teacher, and go through lockers and lost and found and such. Again, the schools are open Monday and Tuesday, May 11-12 from 7:30-4:07 each day, for a final visit, check out, and to answer any questions that you may have.

I look forward to seeing many of you next week and if our paths don't cross, have a great summer!

Mr. Jamie Hermann
